This template expects a table called "template", looking something like the following: template = { image = data.image, shadow = "rounded", -- or 'box' or 'none'; default box image_alt = "PlaceholderPlaylist|128", image_size = 128, icon = "SidebarRowIcon|list", title = data.name, title_link = data.link, stats = playlist_stats, description = data.text, offline_available = data.playlist_offline_available, title_items = { "standard_title", "filler", "stats", editable_icon, }, toolbar_items = { "share", }, } Any of the singular elements may be a function that instead returns a string (see also the insert()-function below). Use this to get translated strings, as can be seen in e.g. playlist_header.xml. Array tables like title_items and toolbar_items should contain either arguments as above, or one of several predefined strings that cause standard elements to be inserted: see the source below for the strings. These standard elements may use template arguments from the template table. ]] -- Use this everywhere a templated chunk is inserted. That way, we can supply normal types as well as functions. function insert(chunk) if type(chunk) == "function" then return chunk() end return chunk end -- Include style sheet. include("views/generic_header_style.xml") %> % if template.image or template.image_alt then % end % for i, item in ipairs(template.title_items) do % if item == "standard_title" then % if template.icon
